question: Does ADAR1 directly bind Dicer to form a complex that enhances Dicer-mediated cleavage of pre-miRNA during microRNA processing? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: In this study, we investigated the interaction of the RNA editing mechanism with the RNA interference (RNAi) machinery and found that ADAR1 forms a complex with Dicer through direct protein-protein interaction.
content.source_2: Using purified recombinant proteins and single-turnover kinetic assays, ADAR1 did not co-immunoprecipitate with Dicer and instead reduced Dicer-dependent pre-miRNA processing by lowering catalytic efficiency (kcat/KM), indicating the absence of a productive ADAR1–Dicer complex.
content.source_3: Most importantly, ADAR1 increases the maximum rate (Vmax) of pre-microRNA (miRNA) cleavage by Dicer and facilitates loading of miRNA onto RNA-induced silencing complexes, identifying a new role of ADAR1 in miRNA processing and RNAi mechanisms.
content.source_4: ADAR1 associated with Dicer only in the presence of double-stranded RNA, and RNase treatment eliminated co-precipitation; overexpression of ADAR1 failed to enhance pre-miRNA cleavage or miRNA loading into RISC, arguing against a direct protein–protein interaction or a stimulatory role in Dicer processing.
